item.title: Travis add a quote by Madeleine L'Engle
item.description: "You have to write the book that wants to be written. And if the book will be too difficult for grown-ups, then you write it for children." -- Madeleine L'Engle

item.title: Travis add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "I find television very educating. Every time somebody turns on the set, I go into the other room and read a book." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Travis add a quote by Gail Carson Levine
item.description: "A library is infinity under a roof." -- Gail Carson Levine

item.title: Travis add a quote by Nicole Krauss
item.description: "Once upon a time there was a boy who loved a girl, and her laughter was a question he wanted to spend his whole life answering." -- Nicole Krauss

item.title: Travis add a quote by Charlotte Brontë
item.description: "I would always rather be happy than dignified." -- Charlotte Brontë

item.title: Travis add a quote by Henry Ward Beecherr
item.description: "Where is human nature so weak as in the bookstore?" -- Henry Ward Beecherr

item.title: Travis add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "Another belief of mine: that everyone else my age is an adult, whereas I am merely in disguise." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Travis add a quote by Robert A. Heinlein
item.description: "Women and cats will do as they please, and men and dogs should relax and get used to the idea." -- Robert A. Heinlein

item.title: Travis add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "I love deadlines. I love the whooshing noise they make as they go by." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Travis add a quote by Steve Martin
item.description: "Some people have a way with words, and other people...oh, uh, not have way." -- Steve Martin

item.title: Travis add a quote by Jules Verne
item.description: "We are of opinion that instead of letting books grow moldy behind an iron grating, far from the vulgar gaze, it is better to let them wear out by being read." -- Jules Verne

item.title: Travis add a quote by Ishmael Reed
item.description: "No one says a novel has to be one thing. It can be anything it wants to be, a vaudeville show, the six o’clock news, the mumblings of wild men saddled by demons." -- Ishmael Reed

item.title: Travis add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Outside of a dog, a book is man's best friend. Inside of a dog it's too dark to read." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Travis add a quote by Stéphane Mallarmé
item.description: "Everything in the world exists in order to end up as a book." -- Stéphane Mallarmé

item.title: Travis add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I am so clever that sometimes I don't understand a single word of what I am saying." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Travis add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Women are meant to be loved, not to be understood." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Travis add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I don't want to go to heaven. None of my friends are there." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Travis add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "This wallpaper is dreadful, one of us will have to go." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Travis add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "It takes great deal of courage to see the world in all its tainted glory, and still to love it." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Travis add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Sanity and happiness are an impossible combination." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Travis add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "All right, then, I'll go to hell." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Travis add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Now and then we had a hope that if we lived and were good, God would permit us to be pirates." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Travis add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Reality can be beaten with enough imagination." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Travis add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Those are my principles, and if you don't like them...well I have others." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Travis add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "I'm not crazy about reality, but it's still the only place to get a decent meal." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Travis add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Anyone who says he can see through women is missing a lot." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Travis add a quote by Art Spiegelman
item.description: "Comics are a gateway drug to literacy." -- Art Spiegelman

item.title: Travis add a quote by Grant Morrison
item.description: "I just wanted all the wars to be over so that we could spend the money on starships and Mars colonies." -- Grant Morrison

item.title: Travis add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Give a man a fire and he's warm for a day, but set fire to him and he's warm for the rest of his life." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Travis add a quote by Katherine Anne Porter
item.description: "The past is never where you think you left it." -- Katherine Anne Porter
